snippet: Makeshift galleries have proliferated in unconventional spaces in response to high costs and a stratified art world beholden to curators and dealers....
abstract: Many artists in New York city and across country have been creating temporary, do-it-yourself galleries in apartments, storefronts and other spaces in response to rising costs and difficulty of getting dealer representation; trend also represents effort by artists to build community in increasingly stratified art world and gain control over careers.
lead_paragraph: Makeshift galleries have proliferated in unconventional spaces in response to high costs and a stratified art world beholden to curators and dealers.

headline.main: It’s an Art Gallery. No, a Living Room. O.K., Both.
headline.print_headline: Art Gallery? Living Room? O.K., Both.
